_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: All Other Miscellaneous Chemical Product and Preparation Manufacturing

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EPA Risk Management Program Executive Summary



1. Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies



Magnablend, Inc. is a privately held, chemical manufacturing, blending, and packaging company located in Waxahachie, Texas.  Magnablend complies with applicable federal, state and local regulations.  All Magnablend employees are informed of hazards in the workplace and are trained accordingly.  Magnablend has procedures in place to safely remove employees from the plant in the unlikely event that a hazardous substance release were to occur, and to put in place emergency notification and response procedures.



2. Facility and Regulated Substances



Magnablend manufactures specialty chemical products for its customers utilizing customer formulations and specifications.  Magnablend specializes in oil field chemicals, agricultural fertilizers, construction chemicals, water treating chemicals, and industrial cleaning compounds.  Anhydrous ammonia is utilized as a raw material in many of the products as a source of nitrogen and pH control.  



3. Worst-Case and Alternate-Case Release Scenarios



Please reference onsite data (Volume 1: Risk Management Plan) at Magnablend's liquid facility.



4. General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Ammonia Specific Prevention



Magnablend, Inc. complies with the OSHA Process Safety Management for Highly Hazardous Chemicals (PSM) standard relative to anhydrous ammonia. Therefore, this facility has programs to ensure proper operation and maintenance of the ammonia storage and piping systems.   All operators associated with the use of anhydrous ammonia have been trained and are knowledgeable in the safe operation of the system.



The storage tank and piping system at this facility has been designed and constructed using good engineering practices and to conform to industry standards. The system includes ammonia detection devices near the storage tank, an excess- flow emergency shutdown valve located on the ma

in line outside the building, an emergency stop button located on the wall in the production facility, an automatic water fog / sprinkler system, and 2 safety relief valves to avert serious system overpressure.  Regular inspections of the storage tank, piping system, and mitigation equipment ensures ongoing system integrity.



5. Five Year Accident History



During the past five years this facility has had no accidental releases of ammonia.



6. Emergency Response Program



Magnablend maintains an excellent relationship with the Waxahachie fire department and local authorities.  In the event of an emergency, Magnablend will initiate an evacuation of the facility and notify the proper authorities, including the Waxahachie Fire Department and LEPC.  Employees are trained to evacuate their respective areas in accordance with OSHA 1910.38(a).



7.  Planned Changes To Improve Safety



Remote level monitoring is being added to the anhydrous ammonia storage tank to give real-time updates to the EHS Coordinator and the Plant Manager. NDT testing of the anhydrous ammonia storage tank will be performed in accordance with Magnablend Liquid Blending Facility Mechanical Integrity Program.
